greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the binary length of A324876(n).
comment: Differs from A324863 [binary length of A324866(n)] for the first time at n=50.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (based on Hans Havermann's factorization of A156552)
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
example: For n = 50, A324876(50) = 9, in binary "1001" with length 4, thus a(50) = 4.
program: (PARI) A324861(n) = #binary(A324876(n)); \\ Needs also code from A324876.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 21 2019
